Class JestersRevenge

  • java.lang.Object
    • greenfoot.World
      • JestersRevenge
  • public class JestersRevenge
extends greenfoot.World
    A grid-based, 2d "bullet-hell" type boss rush game where you play as a star, manuevering around a checkerboard against corrupted kings wielding suits of cards. Deliberately meant to be challenging, requiring quick reflexes, pattern recognition, and some memorisation. Themed around, you guessed it, card suits, and playing cards in general - in this case, the player is the Ace of the imagined "fifth" suit of cards, Stars. They're going after the Kings after they've been corrupted by the Jester, who is sadly not in the game due to time constraints.

    Features:

    - Two solo boss fights, one duo boss fight

    - Player abilities such as a "parry" and a "blank" (or a "bomb")

    - High scores emphasizing skill, speed, and success.

    - Grid-based movement and attacks emphasizing precision and speed

    - Unique, difficult bosses with interesting attacks and engaging gameplay

    Issues:

    - Ease of gameplay is dependent on game lag (laggier = easier)

    - Boss death animation is inconsistent

    - Sometimes, two vulnerability cells appear and only one works

      • evaluateScore

        public void evaluateScore()
        Evaluates the final score of the game. Adds 10000, 20000, 25000 for each bossfight (25000 for both participants in duo fight). Then sets score to itself/secondsTheGameLasted * health (just 1 if health is zero and you died).

      • act

        public void act()
        Act. Spawns a king of diamonds if one hasn't been spawned already, increments the actsTaken variable, decrements a blank timer if a blank is active so it doesn't last forever, updates icons, and checks if all bosses have been defeated (if yes, move to victory)
        Overrides:
        act in class greenfoot.World

      • checkPlayerPresent

        public boolean checkPlayerPresent()
        Checks if the player is pressent in the world.
        Returns:
        boolean true if player is in the world, false if not.

        Checks if the King of Diamonds is not present in the world.
        Returns:
        boolean false if Diamonds is in the world, true if not.

      • initializeBossHealth

        public void initializeBossHealth​(Health[] healthArray,
                                 greenfoot.GreenfootImage healthSprite,
                                 greenfoot.GreenfootImage emptyHealthSprite,
                                 int hSpacing,
                                 int vSpacing,
                                 int startingHeight)
        Initializes an array with images and displays it in the boss health interface.
        Parameters:
        healthArray - an array of Health[] objects (boss healthbar)
        healthSprite - visual appearence of the health icon of each boss
        emptyHealthSprite - visual appearence of a shattered health icon
        hSpacing - horizontal spacing
        vSpacing - vertical spacing
        startingHeight - starting height of the health bar
